result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence imposed as to Count 2; credit for Zero days served.

miscConds.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).

- Obtain GED/HSD
- Full-time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school

- No Contact Order with Kelsey M., Ebony D-M., Aaron S.,   AND/OR   Anthony L.
- No Contact Order with co-defendant Jonathan Lawson

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No drugs without a valid prescription
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Phillips

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  12  MONTHS  in the House of Correction, straight time, with credit for 10 days served.  

As to Count 3:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  12  MONTHS  in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 2; credit for  Zero days served. 

As to Count 3:
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  3  YEARS with the following conditions:
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Full-time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school
- No Contact Order with Kelsey M., Ebony D-M., Aaron S.,   AND/OR   Anthony L.
- No Contact Order with co-defendant Jonathan Lawson
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 673
cf
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  PSI reviewed by the parties and the Court.  No corrections.
Sentencing commenced.  During Court's colloquy with defendant and defendant's statements to the Court, Court declines to proceed to sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Justice Point Discharge Summary, filed and forwarded to Judge Sanders.

BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 21.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Megan Marie Williamson for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court due to Justice Point violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.   Court ordered defendant's Justice Point Supervision be modified to INTENSIVE SUPERVISION.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on Decmber 14, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 21.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defense motion for modification proceeded.   Court modifies bail to $125.00 cash TOT Justice Point with intense monitoring with the following conditions:  Drug testing; breathalyzer tests; absolute sobriety; no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription; no firearms/dangerous weapons; no contact with parties listed on the No Contact Order.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 4 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNTS 2 and 3.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNTS 2 and 3.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 2 and 3 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation.  Parties requests a Presentence Investigation Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Status conference conducted.  Matter set for a projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense Motion to Suppress proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Poice Officer Derek Kitts.  State Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Defense Exhibit 2 offered and received.  Closing arguments heard.  Court denies defense motion to suppress.  Defense waives challenge for search warrant.  Defense exhibit 2 withdrawn.  Matter scheduled for Status.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled for Motion to Suppress.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's motion to suppress fruits of search of premises received and filed.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests this matter be calendared for Motion to Suppress.  Defense to file motion papers by 6/25/2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 4-25-15.
Bench warrant filed.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Return on bench warrant held.  Arguments as to bail made by counsel. Court set cash bail of $750.00 with turn over to Justice Point for Supervision.  Parties engaged in negotiations; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Justice Discharge Report, received and filed.
Defendant picked up on the warrant.  Telephone call to Attorney Douglas Batt.  Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Status Conferance.  Defnedant has failed to appear.   On state's motion, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense request for status date granted.  Defendant in compliance with Justice Point at this time.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report, received and filed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/9/15.

Defendant is ordered to report VERIFIED ADDRESS TO JUSTICE BEFORE NEXT SCHEDULED COURT APPEARNCE DATE, 3/10/15.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is called on the record at approximately 2:30 p.m. Due to non appearance of co-counsel, attorney Goodrich who informed the Court that he had a afternoon appearance in West Bend, case will be rescheduled.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  State did have witness present for today's proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/24/15.

COURT ORDERS OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BAIL TO REMAIN THE SAME.
COURT ORDERS BAIL IN THE AMOUNT OF A $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State is requesting an adjournment at this time.  Defense counsel objects to an adjournment and is requesting a motion to dismiss this criminal complaint. Motion to dismiss this criminal complaint is denied at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail/bond hearing.  Argument made by defense and state.  Defense bail motion denied by the Court.  Case remains set for Preliminary Hearing on 2-18-15 at 1:30 p.m before Preliminary Hearing Court.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kelsey M., Ebony, D., Aaron S., Anthony L., or Jonathan L.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
